content:
Heyo - got a suggestion for a UX/UI improvement. Currently, if you edit your notifications in the settings window and scroll down and click "Save Changes", it looks like you don't get any feedback from the action. If you scroll up, though, you see a static green banner indicating changes were saved.

Is there a way to make that banner sticky in the current view? Or drop down from the parent container or something? Just some way to get an indication of success without having to scroll up and see it (which many people might not do if they just click out of the modal)
@Matt Long we are currently going to standardize all our settings to be instantly saved instead of needing to click a "Save Changes" button.

Even better! Just to check in, though - currently like actually working on that right now? I'm working on refactoring the notification update stuff in the back-end, so that might conflict with changes y'all are making now :grimacing:
Ah, don't worry about it. Nobody is actually working on what I said above yet. We do plan on doing it.
Even even better then
Could be a great part two for your project Matt :-)
(deleted)

Going back to this -- notifications are now all saved on change, but the confirmation message is still at the top of the page. If someone is scrolled out of view of the success message, it's not apparent that the change was applied. To make the message display clearly, could we make it 'sticky', turn it into a modal, or have some other way of displaying that things have changed?
I think a modal is most clear.

I think this is a broader issue with how all of our "you updated settings" alerts work. They could probably benefit from both being modal / over the page, rather than in it (also saves us a bunch of layout cases to test!) and I think perhaps would also benefit from more work on visuals.
I could also imagine something like having checkboxes change color when you've changed them in the current session as a visual cue for what you've done.
Anyway, I guess my point is it's worth giving some thought to a nicer replacement for how the ui_report module works

[Desktop App]
We're trying to add a button to toggle the left sidebar but not sure where to add it. What would be the perfect position of the button? As of now, this is how it looks -
design.gif
https://github.com/zulip/zulip-electron/pull/230

One idea that I think might work OK is to put it in the top-left corner. Ideas on this would be much appreciated!

(Also, what do other multi-server apps do?)
I have not seen this feature in any electron app yet :D
We were thinking of having the org switcher in the bottom left for the webapp as well at some point, in which case bottom left would be a natural place for this.
I think the arrow to hide the accounts is more distracting than having the accounts there. They are taking minimal space, and horizontal space in the app is definitely not a limiting factor.
@Boris Yankov the context here is we've gotten feedback from some users that with their window size, the sidebar is big enough to prevent them from being able to see the right sidebar.

OK, here's a proposal: We have an item in the main menu alongside things like "reload" to toggle it, which is available regardless of the window's state and doesn't take up space or need to interact visually with the main UI.

@Akash Nimare what do you think about that? I feel like probably this isn't a setting a lot of people will be toggling back and forth. And we should set the defaults so with 1 organization, it's default-hidden, and when you add a second, it becomes visible.
I think this is mostly a problem with the 'responsive design' behavior that I have always thought can be improved, but failed to mention/discuss till now
I think that responsiveness is actually one of the low-hanging fruits that are worth improving
The problem is, and it exists in way too many other websites, that we just have arbitrary and aggressive media-queries.
Instead of this, we can have adaptive sizes of the three panels for way longer.
I know the users pains as I always use the browser on my Mac at 3/4ths (the other 1/4th being the iOS simulator)
The user panel hides way too early.

Currently it is 235px wide, but it is very easy to make it 'max: 235px, min: 180px' 180 being very usable.
Similar for the streams, but with extending the max, which will be an improvement over the current style on both min and max ends of the range
And generally the rule will be 1/5th for stream, 1/5th for users, 3/5ths for message list. Then start hiding panels at way later width
I also think the time labels and the paddings are way too large right now.
But just the sizing will likely help shave off 100-200 more usable pixels on smaller screens
If we hide the sidebar when there is only one organization then users might not be able to discover the settings/add servers etc option.
@Boris Yankov can you suggest a better option to place that toggle button?
I think if the suggestions I am giving are addressed in the web app, it will be more than ok to keep them there.
Another option is to make the whole bar horizontal and put it on top (or less optimally at the bottom)

Hrm. I don't think moving it unconditionally would be great (vertical space is valuable in a wide window!), but I guess we could make it possible to flip its location? Might be more work to maintain than we'd like...
Not sure if I am understanding you, Tim. BTW my suggestion was to put it on top of the left sidebar.
Moving places is not only more maintenance, but also is more confusing to the user, so I definitely do not suggest that ;)
Ahh, yeah, top of left sidebar was my original suggestion as well.
And I think we can just hide it if you're in a window so narrow that the left sidebar doesn't show
Better web responsive sizing is an improvement to the web app too, independently of the downloadable version.
Yeah, agreed; I just don't want to the smaller project of unblocking this aspect of the downloadable app efficiently stuck behind that sort of larger effort :).

I think the arrow to hide the accounts is more distracting than having the accounts there.

Agreed. How about putting this in setting option and let user decide since they won't use it frequently -
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S_O3YxmpQbc
• +bind it with a keyboard shortcut.
Yeah that sounds good.
@Zhongyi Tong FYI, let's implement this.
working on it
